Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onelmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a business conference. I must say this is the best hotel experience I have had. Far exceeded my expectations. The hotel staff was friendly, energetic, helpful. We used the shuttle service to get to and from the airport, clean van, courteous, friendly driver. They recommended a great restaurant for dinner. The restaurant in the hotel was wonderful too. Great breakfast and lunch (we didn't have dinner there but I'm sure it is good). The restaurant staff was very attentative. Our room was quiet, up to date, clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, not their best property”
Reviews.Author: Live4Maine
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in the property. Rooms are comfortable and clean, but a little tired. The city and airport view is wonderful. Most disappointing was the noise! Freeway noise and airport noise. Excellent location to Sky Harbor and the 202 loop. If I were to stay here again I would request a non-view room and hope it was quieter.

Reviews.Title: “The employees are amazing”
Reviews.Author: Texincolorado
Reviews.Content: From the time they picked us up at the airport until we left we were treated with class and great service. I would suggest this to anyone. The bell hop, to front desk, to the wait staff were tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: dudspizza
Reviews.Content: We are leisure travelers that stay at budget properties whenever possible. Having a friend who works for Marriott gets us the friends and family discount, which we got at this property. While rack rate was $260/night, we paid $89, though you would have never known it by the way we were treated. The staff treated us like royalty going out of their way to help us. The airport shuttle driver was informative, friendly, and helpful. The front desk clerk was ultra helpful when we checked in at 11:30pm. He even looked up a local Dominos Pizza for us so we could get something to eat. The shuttle driver even offered to drive us up the the iHop if we needed to get something to eat. The next morning the bell staff at the front door welcomed us with a smile and cordial greeting. The rooms for nice, with comfortable beds. As a person who does not travel on business, I have to say that this hotel was one of the nicer hotels I have ever stayed in. I don't have the inflated views of hotels that some frequent travelers have and I look at cleanliness and service. Both were top notch in this hotel! Good job, Marriott Airport Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent, Excellent Marriott”
Reviews.Author: acoulter
Reviews.Content: What a delightful experience. Marriott done good! Good concierge Lounge with adequate space and good service. Staff are well-trained and courteous. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat at the Red Rim if you stay here”
Reviews.Author: Webmiller
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Phoenix Airport itself was decent. The rooms were nice and the beds comfortable. We ate dinner at the Red Rim. It is supposed to be fine dining and the prices support that notion. The service was slow and inconsistent, however very polite. The food was not nearly at the same level as the price. I had the chicken stir fry that was supposed to come with brown rice. The chicken was tough and they gave me white rice. My wife's steak that was supposed to be medium rare, was medium, our daughter's cheese quesadia had chicken and other things it wasn't supposed to and overall the food quality was sub par. The manager did however take 25% off of our bill for all the mess ups and our complaints about the food.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities are very sub-par. Service is good, with some caveats.”
Reviews.Author: KTnDC
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if it's Average or Poor. While I'm glad that some reviewers had a good stay here, I really had a sub-par experience for 2 nights. I almost always stay at Marriott properties, have mid-tier "status" and enjoy the brand. But: 1. The whole hotel (except for the lobby and restaurant) is way over-due for a remodel. The furniture in the elevator lobbies is cracked, chipped, and looks like something you might find along Rt 66 in the hinterlands of Nevada alongside some tumbleweeds. The carpet and wallpaper are no better. My room was a shambles...there had, at some point, been a leak in the room above mine (on the 6th floor) and there's a huge water stain marring the popcorn stucco ceiling above the bed, punctuated by a big, shoddy-workmanship patch-job to the underlying sheetrock. My bed's skirt was stained the entire way around...left side, foot, right side with large black scuff scrapes and stains of an entirely different sort that I don't want to speculate on (I have pictures). 2. The reservations and front-desk staff did nothing to accommodate standard requests. I like to stay on a high floor, and won't cry about it if I don't. My reservation included a request to stay on a high floor. When I checked in with 2 co-workers (one with higher status and one with lower), mysteriously, I got the lowest floor of the three of us even though they hadn't requested a high floor. I pushed back gently with the front desk rep, and was told I was out of luck. So what's the point of asking me if I would like a higher floor if you ignore it and give those rooms to those who have no preference? 3. My toiletries were USED! hahaha. The shampoo bottle was already opened and half empty (again, I snapped a pic for posterity). The eco-friendly person in me thought "well, at least they didn't just dump it out," but I have to admit I wondered what some sick person might have swapped for the shampoo. Here's the upside: Other than my high-floor room being given to my unappreciative coworkers, the staff in the Concierge Lounge is really exceptional. Very, very friendly and they go out of their way to help out. And even with dirty, outmoded furniture and fittings, the bathroom was spotless. After getting a rebuff from the front desk staff, I decided that pursuing this stuff with local management any further wasn't worth it. But it colored my opinion of the place, and regardless of the room condition, the furnishings and decor are clearly from ~20 years ago and have not improved with age.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: FLJ021251
Reviews.Content: I just spent one night at the Marriott near the airport in Phoenix. While this is a full service Marriott, my experience was much less than full-service. I travel almost everyday and last year stayed at 191 different Marriott properties. I called several hours before reaching the hotel to check on my reservation. I was assurred that I was placed on the club level. However, when I got to the hotel I was on the eleventh floor and the club is on the twelth. Also, this hotel does not have suits and it is about six miles fromt he airport! Check in went smoothly, however the two young ladies working at the front desk were not friendly at all and could not provide any directions. They simply handed me a small card with directions Parking can be a problem in that there is not much space. The lobby area has a small bar area and while there was only about eight people in the bar it was very noisy. I think lack of carpet and much tile make sounds very loud. After checking in at 7:20 I went up to the 12th floor to the club to grab a quick snack before dinner. However, the only thing out was sweets. I asked about the food and was told that everything gets put away at 7:00PM. So, they open at 5:30 and put everything away at 7:00. That makes no sense to me. The sleeping room is pretty standard Marriott, however, bedding was worn. The room was quiet and there was a flat screen television. The bathroom was fairly small, but the shower seem to work very well. There are no restaurants within walking distance. I had requested a 5:00 AM wake up call, but that did not happen. My profile request for extra towels and news paper was not followed. This hotel seems to be resting on the fact they they are a Marriott and close to the airport. There are many hotels in this area and some closer to the airport. Next time I will choose to stay somewhere else. I certainly did not receive the service I have come to expect from a Marriott

Reviews.Title: “No surprises, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: slc_singer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights. The room has had its decor updated to look like just about every other Marriott I've stayed in. The bathroom was clean, but needed updating (no granite, no fluffy towels, odd wallpaper). Every staff member I talked with was very friendly and helpful (especially the shuttle driver over to the airport). It was a quiet stay (there were several college athletic teams and a large choir staying there at the same time). Its close to the airport and it had easy freeway access. The pool was small, but it was nice to enjoy in February.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hollyday66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights Feb 10-12 on business. My room appeared to be newly carpeted, and it was very clean and comfortable. It included all the amenities Marriott is known for, as well as a new extra-large flatscreen TV. Although I was on the freeway side, it was surprizingly very quiet. The hotel must also have great insulation because although it was full to capacity I never heard any of my neighbors. The bed was delightfully comfortable & I slept well. The bathroom was large and well appointed. It included a scale. (ot sure if that is a pro or a con! ha ha) As already mentioned in other reviews, the staff here are exceptional. They go out of their way to serve. No matter who I met in the hall or lobby or the maid, I was always greeted with a smile, a hello and they asked me how I was enjoying my stay. The food here is a little pricey, but was very delicious. I am happy to give this hotel my highest rating. Notes: As usual with Marriott, Internet is free in the lobby - $11 per day in room. This hotel is very convenient to the airport. Travellers should be aware that it is a bit of a drive to the downtown, and there are no eating establishments within walking distance. Thus, all meals must either e eaten on sight (two restaurants available), or you will need to take transportation. For those who like outdoor exercise, there is a very nice park/nature reserve jogging trail about 1/2 mile from the hotel which staff will give you directions to. This provides a great 3 mile loop. The hotel includes a decent exercise room, and a nice pool. My only small "complaint" is that the hotel uses a citrus scented cleaning product which seems especially strong when entering the room. I am very sensitive to scent so I got a small headache the first night from it. After that, the smell either dissapated over the next day, or I adjusted used to it. But, it would be nice if they could switch to non-scented cleaning supplies since many people are allergic.

Reviews.Title: “Agree, the staff here are very helpful and go out of their way”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: This is an airport Marriott. Not an airport Ritz Carlton, or an airport Four Seasons. It is an airport Marriott. For that, I received a very large room, incredibly comfortable bed, and among the most enthusiastic and helpful staff you can find. The breakfast service in the restaurant was highly enthusiastic, and the wait staff went out of their way to offer their best hospitality. Yes, this is not the latest in facility upgrades, but the staff goes out of their way to make this an above average airport Marriott. Airport shuttle worked well, and the lobby is more spacious than many other properties. Price paid was comparable to other Phoenix airport stays (I know, I was at a different property the night before).

Reviews.Title: “Just an Average Marriott”
Reviews.Author: stevel30328
Reviews.Content: High price for an average Marriott. Stuck in PHX had to overnight at the hotel. Real plain Marriott, smelled find of funny. The Concierge lounge was old an needed to be remodeled. Turned off the AC unit and it was still loud. Nothing fancy at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: cleste01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few minutes from the airport and has a shuttle bus to the airport or light rail running every 30 minutes. It was a bit dated and there was nothing much within walking distance of this hotel. The lobby and pool are both small. However, parking was free, the restaurant was decent, and room service was fairly prompt. Front desk and lobby staff were very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service offsets dated facilities”
Reviews.Author: shanemat84
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the hotel while on a recent business trip. Hotel is clearly well located for access to the airport. Found rooms and common areas to be dated and the lobby bar looks very much like an afterthought. Staff however were attentive and eager throughout the stay. Only had breakfast in the hotel which was a typical buffet but again found staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: traveloften13
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel when in Phoenix because of its convenience to the airport (not too far, not too close and it is only a few miles to a great shopping center and a casino). The rooms are large, comfortable, and extremely clean. There are other hotels in this area that are cheaper but based on the information provided on the internet do not have the amenities this one does. The staff is very friendly and anxious to assist. The executive lounge is also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here in February 2008 but wanted to make sure I logged a review, especially since it was my longest stay at any one hotel: 11 nights. I'm in the media and was covering the New England Patriots-New York Giants Super Bowl, which was held in (fairly) nearby Glendale at the slick University of Phoenix Stadium. This was one of the NFL's official hotels for the event. The location is probably the major selling point for this hotel. Though not right around the corner from the airport, it's certainly a short drive. Moreover, it's nicely situated at the midway point between downtown Phoenix and Scottsdale and sits next two a pair of major highways. This was convenient for me -- downtown held the official NFL events, while Scottsdale hosted the Super Bowl parties -- and would be for other visitors to the sprawling Phoenix area, I'd wager. Beyond the obvious business district, downtown doesn't have much in the way of attractions: a Diamondbacks or Suns game, and a few decent bars (including Marjerle's, a fun sports bar owned by the former Suns player) and restaurants. Most of the nightlife, meanwhile, is in Scottsdale. The hotel also is not far from some Camelback mountain and other hiking trails if you're looking to do some outdoorsy stuff. More immediately, there are several stores and (mostly chain) restaurants on the streets surrounding the hotel. The hotel itself was nothing special but certainly serviceable. My room was reasonably-sized, though not especially modern. But no real complaints: there was a comfortable bed, a nice TV and a friendly staff. It was February, so I didn't use the pool. If I'm back in Phoenix as a tourist for just a day or two, I may opt for a hotel downtown or in Scottsdale. But, if you expect to be covering a lot of ground in the region, the location of this Marriott may make a lot of sense.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: smontague2868
Reviews.Content: Originally booked at the Hilton Phoenix Airport and promptly walked upon arrival due to 'a couple of people who didn't check out.' Annoying, but the Marriott was a great alternative. When we got there, the tiny little lobby bar was closed, but the bartendress was still there and kindly agreed to serve us a couple of drinks and threw in a couple of free water bottles. Beds were very comfortable, breakfast was great. Only a one-nighter, but I'll skip the Hilton for the Marriott next time I'm there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pointscollector
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the start of a two week holiday and arrive near midnight because the flight from the UK was via Chicago and Los Angeles. Drove from the Phoenix Car Rental facility and was surprised the route my sat nav took me, I was expecting it to be just around the corner. However, that said in daylight it is a lot closer than it appears at night. A really nice Marriott and I was luckily given room 1212 and it had a balcony, so to experience the warm air Phoenix has in the early mornings this is a real bonus. Access to the main road network is first class and although close to the 202 loop you don't hear the road noise. I have to mention the restaurant where I ate the buffet breakfast, the service and presentation were excellent. I would recommend the poached eggs. By the way for those who are Costco members there is a warehouse within a mile straight down the road, no turns until you reach it, that has a gas station so ideal for refueling a rental car before returning it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: We stay her about 1-2 times per year. The service is excellent. We really appreciate how we are treated at check-in and in the restaurant. The rooms are clean and we are very comfortable here. One of the best Marriott's we visit on a routine basis. Very convenient to the airport and a shuttle service is available which is key for us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Marriott, Fine for a Night by the Airport”
Reviews.Author: mrg0137
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for just one night after arriving into Phoenix on a late flight from the east coast. The hotel isn’t too far from the airport, but it is probably three miles or so from it. Airport hotels in Phoenix aren’t clustered right around the airport like they are in some other cities, so be aware of this. We had printed directions ahead of time, but especially at night, coming from the rental car center, we wouldn’t have known where to go otherwise. The hotel is generally pretty nice. We’ve stayed at better and worse Marriotts in the past. The hotel is perched right at the intersection of a couple highways, so I’d recommend requesting a room away from the highway if you’re worried about noise. We were given a room on the side away from the highway and had a nice view facing Scottsdale and Camelback Mountain. The hotel itself is nice enough. The lobby is nice, and the grounds are well manicured with free parking. The rooms are a decent size, and ours was clean. The room décor is a little outdated, a sort of southwestern motif. There have been updates made to the rooms, such as the new Marriott bedding. It was the light fixtures, furniture, etc. that looked outdated. A full renovation of our room had not been completed, and the same goes for the hallways. Otherwise, we didn’t really see anything remarkable about this hotel. It served perfectly well for a quick night by the airport before moving on to the Grand Canyon. I wouldn’t stay here for a vacation. In terms of things in the area around the hotel, I don’t think there was much within walking distance. A couple minutes drive up the road will get you to some grocery stores, Target, and chain restaurants. The area generally looked safe, but not fancy. I think it’s a perfectly acceptable place to stay for a night near PHX.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, just like most reviews stated!”
Reviews.Author: ticket14
Reviews.Content: We were in Phoenix for the MLB All Star game. I am very loyal to Marriott, so I usually choose one of their properties. This was a great hotel for the money. Great service! Great restaruant! Bellman were always offering bottled water and were there if you needed anything. The outdoor pool was clean, but nothing special. Checkin/out was quick and a breeze. The room was fine, the bathroom was a little older, but penty of hot water. I would certainly stay here again for with my wife, but I would choose another place if traveling with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a Full Service Marriott or Just for an Overnight”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlevrywer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for the BCS and were fortunate to get a room at the last minute but would only stay here again if it was just that...a last minute. The rooms seem dated and the halls had a musty smell to it. Although they state to have 3 Concierge Levels, we were not offered a different level should the level we were on be overcrowded which it totally was...very small, nowhere to sit and food almost looked like a hurricane came through it. The Lobby Lounge seemed more like just a Lobby and the restaurant should at least have closed later since the BCS was in town and the hotel was full. Thank goodness for airport shuttle service and an awesome concierge who found us a limo at the last minute to take us to the game.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soccergirl123
Reviews.Content: This is an older Marriott. The location is good. Close (10 minute drive) to the airport. Rooms are dated as well as the lobby. Staff is friendly and make you feel welcome, but not too knowledgeable about the area. When asked for a drug store, I was sent to a super market. Food city. CVS was very close, 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “About what you would expect for an airport marriott”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: Rooms are typical marriott, my guess is refurbished 4 years ago. Good location and they have a free shuttle to the airport. If your in town for business this is a solid choice, if your here for vacation you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Most attentive staff I have experienced in a long time”
Reviews.Author: jagwire858
Reviews.Content: Every staff member from checking, to housekeeping, to restaurant staff were extremely attentive during 2 different stays in a short period of time. I travel most of the year so while the hotel itself was what I expect from a Marriott (good things) the staff was the best I have encountered at any hotel, boutique or otherwise. This is my favorite hotel in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay .. Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: elizba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business and also had an event in the meeting space. The hotel staff was absolutely fabulous. Every staff member I encountered was gracious, made eye contact and wanted to be sure all needs were met. The quality of the food for room service was great.. At the bar/restaurant it was so so. The only headache I had was my room key kept getting demagnitized with any contact with my cell phone so becareful to keep them separated.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: A nice well located hotel. Staff friendly and accommodating. Beware if you are a Gold Elite member...no free breakfast only for Platinum members.. Executive Lounge closed on the weekends. So, a little non-accommodating for some of us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tripster_From_WI
Reviews.Content: I love tripadvisor.com and used the site to find this hotel. It met all my needs--price, location and amenities. Our room was very clean and very spacious (8th floor). The bathroom was the same on both points. It was also very quiet--we seldom heard noise from the hallway and never once heard noise from the adjacent rooms. The beds were nice and comfortable. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and accommodating. We only ate at the hotel restaurant once--for breakfast. It was good, but seemed pricey (as did the lunch and dinner items we saw on the menu). The hotel bar is in the lobby--seemed a little awkward to be there. The pool, hot tub and exercise areas were clean and roomy. The best part really was it's location, as it was close to the freeway so you could get anywhere you wanted in the Phoenix vicinity with the greatest of ease.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: Once again we were VERY pleased with this hotel. Excellent service etc etc etc. Convenient to airport and they have a shuttle!!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location close to airport”
Reviews.Author: starbird2005
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel that was clean, quiet, and near the airport for our trip back East turned out to be tricker than I expected due to all the construction work currently surrounding the airport. This hotel was in a perfect location to get downtown and to the airport with the minimum of hassle. Rooms were clean and staff courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This was a peaceful and delightful spot - very resort like feel.”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre1859
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the 2nd time and again we were very pleased with the sweet and very accomodating staff. The wonderful pool area with unbrellas (something not every hotel has). The breakfast buffet was excellent and the food wonderful. We enjoyed a glass of wine on the outdoor veranda. It has a resort like feel to it and surprisingly very quiet. I also liked the gym and hot tub. It was just a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: lr0che
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. Really nice hotel. Staff was excellent. Gave us breakfast vouchers for their restaurant. Nice breakfast. Beds really comfy and the room was roomy. Enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: not too far from the airport; rooms were typical marriott: clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel overrall we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasPeaches
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, friendly and in a good location. Our room was on the 10th floor and we had a beautiful view of the mountains. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. My son enjoyed the fitness room. I was annoyed by the $14.95 charge to use the internet in my room and the charges to use the business center computer were extremely overpriced- $4.95 for 5 minutes or $7.95 for 15 minutes. Give me a break! But that's not this property's fault I'm sure that is corporate decision.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you need to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: akschalke04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with friends before flying on. Rooms are typical Marriott with nice beds. I was there during a major rain event and my window sills were wet. in fact, water was coming in and I put a towel down to not hear the drops all night. There were no other rooms available because main flights were canceled. The fitness room was also soaked at the windows. The room was way to small. It had the typical, nice LifeFitness equipment but the room was way to small. No fresh water, only tap. At an airport hotel, I expect a casual bar to relax after a long flight. The bar at this hotel was an afterthought as it was in the middle of the cold lobby. It felt like a train station. I frankly have no idea what the designers were thinking when they built this. It's bright and has no more than 8 stools at the "bar". That's it, no tables no nothing. Not a place you want to go to relax. I have seen better "bars" at some Holiday Inn Express where they pull out a temporary bar for a few hours at night to serve guest. Well, the one at the Marriott also closes early, so don't expect to be served if you arrive on a late flight. Room service food is good. There is no 24 hr service and there is no food anywhere if you happen to come in late. Not even vending machines. The shuttle goes every 30 minutes. Not often enough for my taste but Phoenix is also not a major international airport, which may explain why this hotel's service was really lacking compared to Marriotts at major airports. If you are flying through PHX and you need a place to crash, the Marriott is probably fine for one night. If you expect more, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed, but you might not be....”
Reviews.Author: IrishKelly57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is meant for the business traveler, not for vacationing families with teens. I will say the staff is EXTREMELY attentive and well-mannered, ready, willing and able to meet your every need. That being said, there were several aspects of my stay I was not happy with. Internet is not free in the room or in the hotel's "Business Center". The "fitness center" has a limited assortment of equipment, and it was stifling hot with NO fans. The room itself was super - very comfortable bed and clean linens. I was disappointed in the showerhead - no adjustments can be made to the spray, which made it next to impossible to wash my hair, so I actually had to wash it on my knees under the bath faucet! The in-house restaurant was lovely, and the food and presentation was excellent, however it is pricey and close to gourmet, which is another reason this is not a hotel for everyday families with kids. I did however take advantage of room service for breakfast, which was excellent - food was hot when it arrived. Speaking of breakfast - the in-room coffee service was very unsatisfactory - you could brew one single cup of coffee (or two if you also wanted a cup of decaf). I travel with my own coffee and small filters, so I was VERY unhappy with this. There was no mini-fridge either. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but I would first find out if their preferences are the same as mine. If you are traveling on business and have an expense account, this is the place for you (unless you have a dense head of hair).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, not a good value”
Reviews.Author: sellinrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Phoenix Airport for a meeting that pretty much required that I stay there. I was a little surprised at the cost because in most metro areas the hotels at the airport are less expensive than average. Apparently this is not the case in Phoenix, because I paid more than I expected for an otherwise average property. The fitness center in particular was especially lacking, with a limited selection of equipment and very cramped quarters. They placed some of the weightlifiting equipment outside near the pool which I thought was bizarre even for Arizona. I didn't have any particular complaints about the room or accomodations, but if I had to return for another trip to Phoenix, I would shop around and try to find either a nicer hotel for the money or else a better value away from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Marriott near Airport”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: This looks like a brand new Marriott. The rooms were spacious and modern. The bed excellent. The concierge lounge was average, with a poor selection of food at 5PM and unattentive staff. The shuttle service to the airport was reliable and well run. Not much nearby. If you don't have a car, you are pretty much stuck at the hotel restaurant. The sun can cause a problem heating the rooms on the South side of the building, and the air system is not easy to control. However, I found out stay more than acceptable and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ViennaLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel since I had a business conference here. The hotel is very close to the airport (hence the "Airport" in the name) but without the noise. My room faced the airport and I did not hear anything. Freeway access is very close as well. The staff is very friendly and they were on top of all tasks needed for the conference. Sometimes one can tell if a hotel is short staffed, and this was not the case. The rooms are comfortable. The rooms are upgraded as to electronics (flat screen LCD, wireless internet, etc.), but the decor and bathroom is not modern. The bathroom is clean and the bed is comfortable. I did not use the fitness center or the business center. Overall, I have to say that the staff made the difference for this hotel. A smile goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “Decent airport hotel, loud lobby, good service”
Reviews.Author: MR_PHL
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business trip to Phoenix though my corporate travel agent. Overall not many complaints. Location: Its not right on top of the airport, but its close enough. I think you do have to be aware that if you are heading back to the airport, make sure you have enough time for the shuttle bus if there is any traffic. Check-In: Fast and reasonably efficient. Got upgraded to the Concierge Floor so that's a plus. I always request a tube of toothpaste on arrival and received that without problem. Room: Reasonably nice. I still wish Marriott would offer wireless access in the rooms so I wasn't chained to the desk when on the computer, but that's not that fault of this hotel. Service: Great. I had a Southwest Airlines flight the next morning and was going to be at a meeting at the 24 hour mark to print your boarding pass. I provided my confirmation number to the desk agent and asked if they could help me out. I returned and my boarding pass was waiting for me at the front desk. It was A60 (for those of you who know Southwest), so not bad. If I had a complaint, its is that the bar is right in the lobby across from the front desk. So there is lots of seating for bar patrons, and not as much for someone waiting in the lobby for colleagues. The Georgia football fans were in town for the game and took the entire lobby over. Overall, I think this is a good option for a stay near the airport. I only stay in airport hotels when I have early morning flights back east and would stay here again given the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Smith_UK
Reviews.Content: Yes it's a bog standard Marriott but you know what you are getting and when you just arrive after a 10 hour flight and it's 2am body clock but you have to try to stay awake until at least 9am - the Marriott was excellent. Nice and quiet, big room,access to the concierge lounge, swimming pool, just what was needed to unwind and get a good nights sleep to start the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, decent location for the airport”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: I spent a single night here before the Memorial Day weekend. Although the hotel itself was typical for an airport Marriott (which is usually quite good), the service I received was far better than I had expected. The shuttle from the airport was prompt and friendly - the driver handed me an ice cold bottle of water as I boarded. The desk clerk checking me in recognized my name immediately because my wife had called ahead and faxed my kids' report cards - she was excited to give them to me. Though these were small gestures, they made me feel welcome and valued as a guest. The room was very comfortable, clean, and most importantly, quiet. The restaurant was nice but definitely overpriced. Internet access is NOT free. The concierge lounge on the 12th floor has a free continental breakfast in the morning and an honor bar in the evening. The shuttle runs continuously - the ride to the airport takes about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “It's noisy on the highway side of the hotel!”
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at the Marriott Airport in Phoenix once a year for the last five years. The last time we were there in April 08 we learned to ask for a room on the opposite side of the hotel from the highway. Our room faced the highway and the airport in the distance. The traffic noise was loud and constant all night long. I have a hearing handicap and the noise was still enough to keep this otherwise sound sleeper tossing and turning. We'll stay there again but only on the other side of the building away from the noise of the highway. The staff, cleanliness, parking, and location are all excellent. Skip the restaurant for dinner. The menu is nice but the food was overdone. The restaurant is clean and has great service staff but the food preparation is not Marriott standard. It is a bother that they still charge for internet service!

Reviews.Title: “marriott phoenix airport better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tri24
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was very convenient. Pool was heated and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was spacious and in good shape. Unfortunately, during our stay, the vending machines on all floors werent fully stocked: no bottled water! arghh!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you need to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: GranolaGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this Marriott. The staff is friendly enough. The rooms are pleasant, quiet and clean with flatscreen tv, blonde wood furnishings... typical modern Marriott decor. The view is of the highway on one side and the neighborhood on the otherside (nothing spectacular). You'll need a car if you stay here. There is nothing near here that you can walk to. I arranged with the front desk to take a "taxi" to Old Town Scottsdale for the day. They said it would cost $15-$20 one way. The "taxi" turned out to be "Continental Carriage" which is a town car service with a minimum charge of $32 not including tip. About 10 minutes from this hotel is a good steakhouse named "The Stockyards." We had a great meal here - it's on the National Register of Historic Places and is on a site that once overlooked a feed yard of 40,000 head of cattle (you'd never know it now - it's on a busy road with office parks and urban stuff). We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and the food was fine but ordinary. I ordered a glass of wine from the bar one night to take up to my room. It was obvious that this bar does not get a lot of traffic as the wine tasted like it had been sitting around awhile and was virtually undrinkable. Overall, this is a very nice hotel for an airport hotel. I'd stay here again, but only if I needed to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: PinguinVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in November 2007 during a business trip to Phoenix. The Marriott is convenient to PHX airport without being noisy and is an attractive property. The rooms are Marriotteque, which I consider a plus when traveling on business. My elite membership gave me access to the Executive Lounge, which was also very nice. My only complaint is that my room service breakfast was late, and as a result I barely had time to inhale my food before leaving for the airport. There are likely to be cheaper alternatives near Sky Harbor Airport, but overall I was pleased with the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, tired facilities”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: I stay here routinely for business in PHX. The staff is great, both at the front desk and the concierge lounge, but the property is in DIRE need of investment. Fitness center is barely the size of a single room on the ground floor, the "business center" is two pay-per use computers, and the rooms are getting run-down. I stay here because we have a great rate for our office staff, but I'm at the point of looking at other properties just for comfort, even if sacrificing some convenience and confronting more traffic due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: travelwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Centralized for those who want to be near the airport to catch an early flight. Lobby area, nicely presented. Room - big enough to feel comfortable with access to internet for $9.95, bed is quite comfortable for a good night sleep and walls thick enough not to hear your next door neighbor. Bathrooms are big enough with assortment of shampoo, conditioner, and lotions courtesy of Bath and Body - Hotel provides mouthwash as well. Staff is quite friendly and always makes a point to say hello/goodbye each time your in the lobby area. Complimentary coffee in-room. Fits the needs for travelers who are visiting the Phoenix area for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff....”
Reviews.Author: dcdogmom
Reviews.Content: We stay here 2 nights on the way in and out of Phoenix. We went to the Grand Canyon in between. The staff here was really nice. Friendly, helpful and professional. A guy that is a regular there said the staff is always like that. Rooms were good. We paid over $200 on a weeknight and about $130 for a Saturday night. We are Marriott Silver and were given club privledges. A great breakfast buffet.One of the best I have had. We ate dinner there both nights. Nothing outstanding but good. Coconut shrimp was really excellent....had it both nights. Service was friendly and fast. A bit expensive but expected in a hotel. This is definately a business person's hotel. I would stay here again if I wanted to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and nice room”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDoc
Reviews.Content: I recieved a Friday and Saturday night stay from a charity auction. However, as I wanted to go to the Grand Canyon, I asked if they would honor the second night upon my return. The answer was a quick accommodating, "YES". The room was pleasant and spacious. Free bottled water was available. The only problem was that I tried to get soda from the machine and nothing came out. When I went to the reception to complain, they not only refunded my money, but gave me a keycard to the hospitality suite for the penthouse guests. I was able to help myself to free soda, water and fruit! The stay also included a free breakfast, and as we were late for the buffet, they let us order from the menu. The wait staff were friendly and made my stay very enjoyable.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Phoenix Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 1101 North 44th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85008
